result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

chargeModifiers.descr: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Michael A Neal

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Michael A Neal appeared by video.  Attorney Jason Canfield appeared by video for Michael A Neal.  Attorney Mallory R Davis in court for State of Wisconsin.
Scheduling conference held. Defense counsel requests a DPA hearing. Case is adjourned to Br. 29.
Deferred prosecution agreement hearing scheduled for November 30, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

Defendant Michael A Neal appeared by video.  Attorney Jason Canfield appeared by video for Michael A Neal.  Attorney Mallory R Davis in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Case set for a preliminary hearing. Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed.  Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial. Defense acknowledges receipt of the Information, waives reading and enters a plea of not guilty on behalf of his client. Case is adjourned to Br. 29.
Scheduling conference scheduled for October 21, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Case set for an order to show cause hearing on 9/22/22 at 8:30 am. Defense counsel was recently appointed and requests matter be set for a preliminary hearing. Preliminary hearing set for 9/21/22 at 2:00 pm. Parties notified via email.

Defendant Michael A Neal in court.  Mallory R Davis appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case set for a preliminary hearing. The PD's Office needs additional time to appoint counsel. Court finds CAUSE to adjourn the preliminary hearing. State requests a State v Lee hearing.  Case is adjourned to Br. 29.  Order to show cause hearing scheduled for September 22, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with JNB.
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT TO REPORT TO THE MILWAUKEE COUNTY JAIL (CJF) TO BE BOOKED AND RELEASED BY 5:00 P.M. ON 8/5/22. IF THEY FAIL TO APPEAR, A BENCH WARRANT WILL BE ISSUED FOR THEIR ARREST.

Defendant Michael A Neal in court with Attorney William Anthony Rakestraw.  Michael J. Odden appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Kiefer, Branch 29.
Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  
DEFENDANT DOES QUALIFY FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch 29.


  Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 15, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Summons mailed.  Defendant ordered into room 221 Safety Building on 8/3/22 @ 2p
